main event: A witness observed a bright circular object in the sky on May 8, 1959, that moved quickly and disappeared after approximately 5 seconds.
interesting points: The object was described as large and bright, estimated at 50-75 feet in diameter., The witness observed the object while in their backyard on a clear night., The object moved at an estimated speed of 600 mph in a straight line without deviation., Analysis ruled out conventional aircraft, satellites, meteors, and balloons as explanations for the sighting., The witness reported the phenomenon to the police and an Air Force officer.
witness description: Civilian, approximately 50 years old, 5'10", 170 lbs., light brown hair, blue eyes.
